Summary: Define component inputs via `[Prop]` fields and set them fluently from parents to control appearance and behavior.
Remarks: In MauiReactor, components accept properties using `[Prop]`-annotated fields. Parents set these via fluent methods generated from the prop names (e.g., `.Message(

)`, `.IsBusy(true)`). Use props to parameterize components and keep `Render()` declarative. For long operations, start work in `OnMounted()` and update state asynchronously; drive child props from state to reflect progress. When setting props across pages or boundaries, prefer passing a Props object (see Navigation) rather than reaching into other pages directly.
